message:
> How i can free Asp thread without making my method async here?

Sorry, that's not possible. :/

Think about how the synchrony/asynchrony of an API affects the calling thread: an asynchronous API may complete asynchronously, and then you can yield to your caller by using `await`. But a synchronous API *must* block the calling thread. To a thread, that's what synchronous *means*. So there's no way to avoid blocking a thread with a synchronous call.

So your only options really are either to keep it synchronous, or let the asynchrony grow through the codebase. The only way to free up a request thread in ASP.NET is to use [async all the way](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/jj991977.aspx). If you have a complex codebase and want to allow asynchrony, say, for a single route without having to change *everything*, check out the boolean argument hack in my article here: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/mt238404.aspx
